newsitem.title: USA: US House panel approves MFN for Mongolia, Laos.
newsitem.headline: US House panel approves MFN for Mongolia, Laos.

text.p: The House Ways and Means trade subcommittee approval a bill on Tuesday granting permanent most favored nation trade (MFN) status to Mongolia.
Mongolia's MFN status had been subject to a law that requires annual review of communist countries' emigration policies as is China's MFN status.

Subcommittee Chairman Phil Crane, an Illinois Republican, said that after 70 years of communism, Mongolia is transforming itself into a modern parliamentary democracy and has held four national elections under its new constitution.
He also noted that Mongolia has joined the World Trade Organization.
The subcommittee also voted to give permanent MFN to Laos, which until now was one of a handful of countries denied that trading privilege with the United States.

Crane said the administration is negotiating a bilateral trade agreement with Laos and the legislation would allow President Clinton to extend MFN status after the trade agreement has been entered into force.
Both measures were passed by voice vote and will go to the full committee for consideration before going to the full House of Representatives.
